abstracts.cdata!:
Papua New Guinea's economic
            performance was on an improving trend in the second half of
            the 1980s. Overall economic growth revived sufficiently
            during 1985-88 to allow some recovery in per capita income
            following several years of decline. The objective of this
            Structural Adjustment Loan is to support the stabilization
            and structural adjustment program the Government has
            embarked on in response to adverse shocks, including the
            closure of Bougainville mine. The program focuses on : 1)
            macroeconomic policy adjustments to maintain financial
            stability; 2) improvements in public resource management; 3)
            improving expenditure management; 4) enhancing institutional
            capacities; and 4) promotion of the nonmining private
            sector, through adjustments in exchange rate and wage
            policies, investment deregulation, privitization, and trade
            policy reform.
